result.execSummary:
The defendant George Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endandgering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: As to both counts: Pay all costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 9-21-15. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence - Time Served.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Elizabeth Longo. 
Deputy Court Clerk:  cmt
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.
Return of property hearing on May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for George Williams
Current: 4641 N 27th St Apt 103, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 03-25-2015)
Prior: 1730 N. 7 St., Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant George Williams in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS TO COUNT #1 & #2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant ordered to serve 2 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (2) day - Time Served. 
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 9-21-2015.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered defendant is to pay all costs and surcharges by 9-21-2015.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered
filed against the defendant.
AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant ordered to serve 2 days in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other sentence with credit of (0) days - Time Served. 
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 9-21-2015.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered defendant is to pay all costs and surcharges by 9-21-2015.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered
filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk jks

Defendant George Williams in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant George Williams in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant George Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for George Williams
Current: 1730 N. 7 St., Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 02-03-2015)
Prior: 8869 West Appleton Avenue #11, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
